com.senacor.portal.sc.backend.service

Class InactiveEmployeeManagementService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.senacor.portal.sc.backend.service.InactiveEmployeeManagementService

  • @Service
public class InactiveEmployeeManagementService
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal service, used in batch job service to manage employees in the context of their presence in the company This service should not be a part of any REST API

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InactiveEmployeeManagementService(EmployeeRepository employeeRepository) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void lookForInactives(java.util.List<FisCSEmployeeBase> fetchedFromFis)
      When an employee leaves company, he will be marked as inactive and endDate property will be set, therefore all his SCs will be marked as inactive too
      void partiallyFlushEmployeeData()
      After one year, an employee is inactive -> left the company, all unnecessary data will be deleted, only name with id will be held, in order to keep consistency of existing data referencing the employee

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

public InactiveEmployeeManagementService(EmployeeRepository employeeRepository)

    • Method Detail

      • lookForInactives

        public void lookForInactives(java.util.List<FisCSEmployeeBase> fetchedFromFis)
        When an employee leaves company, he will be marked as inactive and endDate property will be set, therefore all his SCs will be marked as inactive too

      • partiallyFlushEmployeeData

        @Transactional
public void partiallyFlushEmployeeData()
        After one year, an employee is inactive -> left the company, all unnecessary data will be deleted, only name with id will be held, in order to keep consistency of existing data referencing the employee
